The Sunnegga and Rothorn areas are especially popular, and the resort continues to expand its bike-friendly infrastructure. Bike rentals and guided tours are widely available. 5. Take the Sunnegga funicular This underground train gets you from the village to the Sunnegga plateau in under five minutes. From here, you can hike, bike, or simply enjoy the views of the Matterhorn. It’s also the start of the Five Lakes Trail. 6. Visit the Ricola Herb Garden Above the village, near the Edelweiss trail, you’ll find a Ricola demonstration garden with 13 herbs used in their iconic sweets. It’s a quiet and fragrant place to pause and learn something new. The garden is free to visit and best enjoyed in summer. 7. Walk through the Gorner Gorge A short walk from the village, this narrow gorge is carved by glacial meltwater and features wooden walkways suspended over rushing turquoise water.
